column2: Applies to ANY educational agency/institution receiving funds from the Dept. of Education (Public K-12 + Most Higher Ed).
Does NOT preempt stricter state laws.
Any individual who is/has been 'in attendance'. Explicitly EXCLUDES applicants denied admission.
Record directly related to a student and 'maintained' by the agency.

1. Sole Possession (Teacher's private notes).
2. Law Enforcement Unit records.
3. Employment records.
4. Medical records (for students 18+).
5. Alumni records.
Are NOT education records until the teacher collects and records the grade.
Schools must provide access to records within **45 days**.
Request Amendment -> Hearing (if denied) -> Written Explanation (if hearing denied).
Info not generally harmful (Name, dates of attendance). School must provide notice & opportunity to opt-out. SSNs are NEVER directory info.
Directory Info, School Officials (legitimate interest), Health/Safety Emergency.
School nurse records are **Education Records** (FERPA), NOT PHI (HIPAA).
None. (*Gonzaga Univ v. Doe*). Remedy is withholding federal funds.
Elementary and Secondary schools receiving federal funds. (Does NOT apply to Higher Ed).
Includes Political affiliation, Mental problems, Sex behavior, Illegal behavior, Family appraisals, Privileged relationships, Religion, Income.
Parents have the right to **inspect** all instructional material.
Vendor can receive data w/o consent if: Performs school service, under direct control of school, uses data ONLY for authorized purpose.
Voluntary code (enforceable as UDAP) prohibiting selling student data or using it for behavioral targeting.
